result.execSummary:
The defendant Dayveon T Benson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide SNA sample; pay Surcharge (unless previously done). All mandatory court costs, fees and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay all supervision fees.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- Maintain or seek verifiable full-time employment or education or vocational training.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

- No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
- No possession of any firearms or ammunition.

- AODA assessment; comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Undergo random urine screens (no rights to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.
- Agent to notify Court upon 2 consecutive positive test for drugs or alcohol.

- Defendant to contact probation immediately.
- Comply with all rules of probation or extended supervision and any other conditions deemed appropriate by your Agent or the Court.
- Cooperate with Agent.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive with count 1; with credit for 8 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dayveon T Benson

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.

Defendant Dayveon T Benson in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Dayveon T Benson.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for sentencing hearing. Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 : The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive with Count 2. The Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2 : The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 36 MONTHS, consecutive with Count 1, with credit for 8 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- As to Count 1 : 90 days condition time in the House of Correction STAYED.
- Absolute sobriety.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
- Undergo random urine screens (no right to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.
- Agent to notify Court upon 2 consecutive positive test for drugs or alcohol .
- Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge (unless previously done).
- Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
- No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
- Maintain or seek verifiable full time employment or education or vocational training.
- Comply with all rules of probation or extended supervision and any other conditions deemed appropriate by your agent or the court.
- Cooperate with agent
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant to contact probation immediately.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Defense Sentencing Documents - Character Letters, filed.
The Court INCREASES Justice Point SUPERVISION to Level 5.  Court ORDERS random urine screens, drug tests and breathalyzer test.  All other conditions previously ordered remain the same.

Defendant Dayveon T Benson in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Dayveon T Benson.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea hearing.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Any character letters shall be filed at least 3 days prior to next hearing. 

Defendant is NOT remanded into custody, but is ordered to report to Justice Point immediately.  Court INCREASED Justice Point Supervision to Level 5, with modified conditions.  Case adjourned to Branch 9 for Sentencing. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dayveon T Benson in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in Court for continued Pretrial Conference. Defense has received discovery from the State.  Defense requests additional time to review possible plea and requests Plea hearing date. Plea documents shall be filed prior to next hearing date. Matter adjournd to Br. 9.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dayveon T Benson in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets 06/21/2022 as the deadline for the exchange of all discovery materials, with the exception of crime lab reports. Court sets 08/03/2022 as the deadline for filing any motions or change of plea forms.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dayveon T Benson in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appear by video means. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Oak Creek PO William Eisenhardt.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dayveon T Benson in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dayveon T Benson in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Dayveon T Benson in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dayveon T Benson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
